nodes.description: Defeat the Illusory Pot. Soloable by Lv.50 with very little trouble. If the Illusory Pot should sleep you as it did me and your fellow die before you awaken, then you must wait until the next game day to fight the NM again.

nodes.title: Afterward, inspect the ??? once more for a cutscene, which also explains the partnership between the
nodes.description: Afterward, inspect the ??? once more for a cutscene, which also explains the partnership between the two thieves in Bait and Switch.

nodes.title: After the cutscene you are given a Costume Kit and your choice of one of three Tactics Manuals: Tact
nodes.description: After the cutscene you are given a Costume Kit and your choice of one of three Tactics Manuals: Tactics Manual: Endurance, Tactics Manual: Fortitude or Tactics Manual: Might. Choose one to complete the quest. The Costume Kit is a one-time-use Temporary Key Item that can be used in the quest Bait and Switch to obtain an Icarus Wing. The Costume Kit will be consumed when you receive the Icarus Wing. Note that it is necessary to have completed Bait and Switch at least six times, one time for each path (Bard's Harp, Lead Guardsman's ID, Lucky Charm, Pocket Watch, Scope, and Snare), before you can use the Costume Kit in the quest.

nodes.description: Speak with Brutus in Upper Jeuno near the Chocobo Stables, for a cutscene. He will speak of a chocobo's love for running in La Theine Plateau, like they did when they were wild. One chocobo will want to leave, and you have to choose the option to let him out. If you try to choose "No, think of Brutus!" the cutscene will just keep re-prompting you.

nodes.title: Brutus, finding out that a Chocobo is missing, asks you to go find him.

nodes.title: Speak to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Speak to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno for a cutscene. You may receive a cutscene that involves someone wishing to write a story about your adventures with your fellow. If you receive this cutscene, travel to Ru'Lude Gardens and speak to Ajahkeem near the Rendezvous Point to quickly finish the quest. This quest is to enable the use of 'Fellow Points', and has nothing to do with the level cap quest. Talk to Luto again to receive the proper cutscene to trigger Clash of the Comrades. If Luto Mewrilah will not give you the cutscene, make sure your Signal Pearl is equipped and talk to her again.

nodes.title: Once you have received the cutscene involving a head-to-head battle with your fellow, head to Qu'Bia
nodes.description: Once you have received the cutscene involving a head-to-head battle with your fellow, head to Qu'Bia Arena in Fei'Yin.

nodes.title: This is a 10 minute uncapped BCNM solo fight in which you will not lose experience points if you are
nodes.description: This is a 10 minute uncapped BCNM solo fight in which you will not lose experience points if you are knocked out while participating. All buffs are removed upon entering the BCNM. Despite it being uncapped, Automatons are dismissed upon entering. If attempting this fight as Puppetmaster, be sure to Deactivate or have your Activate timer ready before entering. TP is reset upon entering the BCNM. If you bring Reraise and die outside of aggro range, you can get up and heal. Your NPC does not regen HP. Unlike the Maat fight, your fellow will engage you as soon as you are within range. If you come within range, your fellow will not wait for you to make the first move. But, like the Maat fight, your fellow will give up at approximately a similar HP percentage.

nodes.title: Talk to Chululu Lower Jeuno (I-8) to receive 5 Tarut cards, all of the same type.
nodes.description: Talk to Chululu Lower Jeuno (I-8) to receive 5 Tarut cards, all of the same type. Optional: Activate Records of Eminence 15th Vana'versary III objective Full Deck (W) for sparks and experience. It is possible to receive additional cards after a certain period of time if the quest remains incomplete. You must wait one day (Earth time) in order for her to give you new cards. Talking with her again may flag All in the Cards and give you 5 more. If you don't know anyone who has flagged this quest, this is probably the most reliable - if lengthy - way to complete it, as she can give you a different set of cards when you go back to see her. Thus, it's entirely possible to collect the four different cards this way. Discarding the extra cards from a set may increase the odds of her giving you a different set the next time you speak with her. Find other players who have started the quest and trade with them until you have all four different cards (Death, Hermit, King, Fool). Cards cannot be sold on the Auction House, but they can be traded and bazaared.

nodes.title: Trade the four different cards to Chululu to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Trade the four different cards to Chululu to complete the quest. If you have not completed Your Crystal Ball, then you will receive a cutscene with Kurou-Morou. Once this quest is completed, it is possible to ask Chululu for your compatibility with another player. The player name is asked to be specified in a "Password" field on the screen, and the player must be nearby.

nodes.title: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Speak with Rhea Myuliah for a cutscene where you can practice your performance.
nodes.description: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Speak with Rhea Myuliah for a cutscene where you can practice your performance. The goal is to have the biggest audience in the end. There are many NPCs watching both the Valeriano and Brilioth troupes. Certain dances attract certain age groups away from the Valeriano troupe. Regularly, via menu select, you will be asked what kind of dance to do: Waltzes, which young men/women like Sambas, which older people like. Jigs, which children like A sixty-second clock accompanies the dance-select menu in the upper-left corner of your screen. Quickly select the dance you want to do so you can do more dances within the time limit and garner more favor from the crowd. You may practice as often as you like.

nodes.title: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Wait for the Vana'diel day to change.
nodes.description: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Wait for the Vana'diel day to change. Speak with Laila again for a cutscene where you perform for real. You must be on DNC to trigger this CS. Audience is composed of 3 children, 2 young men/women, and 2 older people. Focus on Jigs and Waltzes so at least 5 of 7 will watch your performance and you'll win for sure. If you succeed, you will be rewarded with the Dancer's Casaque. You must have at least half of the audience (4 people) watching Brilioth to complete this quest. The actual performance is significantly more difficult than the practice. Even after the clock hits 0:00, there is still about a 5-second window (while the next cutscene is loading) that Valeriano can steal your audience and you are unable to do anything about it. If the actual performance is failed, you must wait one more game day and zone before you may try again. Simply alternating Waltzes and Jigs quickly enough guarantees a win. Get to each one as fast as possible (for example, after a Jig, start pressing [Enter] to do a Waltz immediately).

An ellipsis (...) appears to help with timing; every (...) is 1 second. After the last timing appears (...?) you must count on your own to 10.

nodes.title: {Batallia Downs} 10 minutes - Start: Upper Jeuno zone ---> End: Syrillia at (E-6).
nodes.description: {Batallia Downs} 10 minutes - Start: Upper Jeuno zone ---> End: Syrillia at (E-6). A 10 minute timer will appear on screen. Visit any 5 out of 8 marked points, and then finally Syrillia at (E-6). You must open up the map and map menu and thumb through the "Markers" lists to see them. Inside each point is "Raptor's Food", down inside Barrows. Barrow entrances are marked with a blue vertical beam as you near them. The food is a bowl/basket on the floor. You must ride close to the food to consume it (clicking not required). The food will disappear. Your raptor will have heart icons around it's head. A message will print to the chat log letting you know how many more points you need to visit to complete the quest, or whether you should now seek out Syrillia. A small amount of "Motivation" and "Pep". Mini-game mechanics: "Motivation" & "Pep" meters. Motivation decreases over time At about 50%, mount loses speed. Motivation reduces faster over steep hills, indicated by a red "!" and sweat marks. Pep slowly regenerates over time Is converted into Motivation via /cheer. Indicated by yellow musical notes on your mount. Once you have spoken to Syrillia at the end of the course, you will be automatically returned to Upper Jeuno. If you run out of time or Dismount, you will be given several options: Try again, Try again at a lowered difficulty, or Give up. Lowering the difficulty does not affect the quest rewards, increases the time limit to 30 minutes, and changes the Motivation meter to drain more slowly and the Pep meter to fill more quickly.

nodes.description: After the battle, return to Upper Jeuno and speak to Luto Mewrilah for a cutscene. You must have Signal Pearl in your inventory, Mog Satchel or Mog Sack.

nodes.title: Head to Lower Jeuno and click on the first door on the left inside the Neptune's Spire (J-7) for the
nodes.description: Head to Lower Jeuno and click on the first door on the left inside the Neptune's Spire (J-7) for the final cutscene.

nodes.title: Talk to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno (G-8).
nodes.description: Talk to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno (G-8).

nodes.title: Once your NPC is level 56, (with your Signal Pearl in your inventory or your Mog Satchel or Mog Sack
nodes.description: Once your NPC is level 56, (with your Signal Pearl in your inventory or your Mog Satchel or Mog Sack) talk to Ratoto in Upper Jeuno (I-10).

nodes.title: Talk to Luto Mewrilah at (G-8) for another cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Luto Mewrilah at (G-8) for another cutscene. Luto Mewrilah must mention going to Southern San d'Oria before next cutscene will trigger.

nodes.title: Talk to Raimbroy, inside Raimbroy's Grocery in Southern San d'Oria (E-8).
nodes.description: Talk to Raimbroy, inside Raimbroy's Grocery in Southern San d'Oria (E-8). You may have to speak to him twice to get the correct cutscene.

nodes.title: Return to Upper Jeuno and talk to Luto Mewrilah.
nodes.description: Return to Upper Jeuno and talk to Luto Mewrilah.

nodes.title: Travel to Beadeaux, and go to (M-8) on map 2 to zone into Qulun Dome.
nodes.description: Travel to Beadeaux, and go to (M-8) on map 2 to zone into Qulun Dome. Check the ??? at (I-6) (remember to navigate past the NMs in Qulun). This is the same ??? as the Beadeaux Limit Break 3 quest Whence Blows the Wind.

nodes.title: Return to Upper Jeuno and talk to Luto Mewrilah again to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Return to Upper Jeuno and talk to Luto Mewrilah again to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Sattal-Mansal (Lower Jeuno) after you talked to the Tenshodo leader while you are on the Mag
nodes.description: Talk to Sattal-Mansal (Lower Jeuno) after you talked to the Tenshodo leader while you are on the Magicite mission.

nodes.title: He will ask you for a Quadav Charm and in return he will give you a Coruscant rosary.
nodes.description: He will ask you for a Quadav Charm and in return he will give you a Coruscant rosary.

nodes.title: The Quadav Charm is found in Beadeaux dropped off De'Vyu Headhunter.
nodes.description: The Quadav Charm is found in Beadeaux dropped off De'Vyu Headhunter.

nodes.title: After you have spoken with Aldo for the mission Magicite, speak with Sattal-Mansal (Lower Jeuno).
nodes.description: After you have spoken with Aldo for the mission Magicite, speak with Sattal-Mansal (Lower Jeuno).

nodes.title: He will give you a Black Matinee Necklace in return for a Quadav Augury Shell.
nodes.description: He will give you a Black Matinee Necklace in return for a Quadav Augury Shell.

nodes.title: The Quadav Augury Shell drops from Go'Bhu Gascon, who is found in Beadeaux.
nodes.description: The Quadav Augury Shell drops from Go'Bhu Gascon, who is found in Beadeaux.

nodes.title: The Quadav Augury Shell can also be sold from player bazaars.
nodes.description: The Quadav Augury Shell can also be sold from player bazaars.

nodes.title: Trade the shell to Sattal-Mansal for your reward.
nodes.description: Trade the shell to Sattal-Mansal for your reward.

nodes.title: Complete Your Crystal Ball and have Kurou-Morou tell your fortune on three separate game days.
nodes.description: Complete Your Crystal Ball and have Kurou-Morou tell your fortune on three separate game days. Talk to him on a fourth day to begin this quest. If you are doing this quest for the Sleepga II quest line, it is suggested that you work on the quest Collect Tarut Cards]], the prerequisite for Rubbish Day, at the same time. Both quests require several game days to complete.

nodes.title: Talk to the Nomad Moogle in Ru'Lude Gardens to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to the Nomad Moogle in Ru'Lude Gardens to start the quest. If you haven't yet unlocked Merit Points, they will be unlocked now. Talk to the Nomad Moogle again after receiving the Limit Breaker (He will ask you for 5 Kindred's Seals ).

nodes.title: Trade the Nomad Moogle 5 Kindred's Seals while having 3 stored Merit Points to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Trade the Nomad Moogle 5 Kindred's Seals while having 3 stored Merit Points to complete the quest. You will lose the 5 Kindred's Seals and your 3 Merit Points. You can withdraw Kindred's Seals that you have stored with Shami in Port Jeuno and use them to complete this quest. Additionally, Shemo will exchange other types of seals and crests at a rate of 3:1.

nodes.title: Radeivepart asks you to bring him a Flame Degen.
nodes.description: Radeivepart asks you to bring him a Flame Degen.

nodes.title: A Flame Degen drops from Napalm, can be crafted (Alchemy47), can be bought at AH, or bought for 480
nodes.description: A Flame Degen drops from Napalm, can be crafted (Alchemy47), can be bought at AH, or bought for 480 sparks from an A.M.A.N. Representative. Note: As of July 2017, if you complete this quest, you also receive 2000 gil and 2000 Experience Points.

nodes.title: Speak with Darcia in Lower Jeuno (H-7) and obtain a Temporary Geomagnetron.
nodes.description: Speak with Darcia in Lower Jeuno (H-7) and obtain a Temporary Geomagnetron.

nodes.title: Check a Geomagnetic Fount at ONE of the following locations:.
nodes.description: Check a Geomagnetic Fount at ONE of the following locations:

nodes.title: Talk to Mertaire inside the Merry Minstrel's Meadhouse, and he'll ask you to get rid of a bracelet f
nodes.description: Talk to Mertaire inside the Merry Minstrel's Meadhouse, and he'll ask you to get rid of a bracelet for him. Agree to help him and you'll receive Mertaire's Bracelet. You can change jobs after receiving the key item if you wish. You do not have to be a Bard to fight Tros.

nodes.title: Head to Ranguemont Pass and proceed past the granite door in the room with the San d'Orian guards.
nodes.description: Head to Ranguemont Pass and proceed past the granite door in the room with the San d'Orian guards.

nodes.title: Go to (D-5) in the northwest corner of the map.
nodes.description: Go to (D-5) in the northwest corner of the map. There are some level 90+ monsters on the way to (D-5) that aggro players of any level, so Sneak and Invisible are required. Circumspection from the Grounds Tome at (G-8) grants these effects for 5 tabs.

nodes.title: Click the "Waters of Oblivion" to spawn Tros.
nodes.description: Click the "Waters of Oblivion" to spawn Tros.

nodes.title: Kill Tros and click the "Waters of Oblivion" again for a cutscene and your Paper Knife.
nodes.description: Kill Tros and click the "Waters of Oblivion" again for a cutscene and your Paper Knife.

nodes.title: Zone after the previous quest, then talk to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno (G-8) for a cutscene that s
nodes.description: Zone after the previous quest, then talk to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno (G-8) for a cutscene that starts the quest. If you get a cutscene regarding Fellow Points, talk to Luto again.

nodes.title: Head to the Optistery in Windurst Waters North and talk to Tosuka-Porika (G-8) for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Head to the Optistery in Windurst Waters North and talk to Tosuka-Porika (G-8) for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Obtain six food items: Bison Steak, San d'Orian Tea, Icecap Rolanberry, White Bread, Whitefish Stew,
nodes.description: Obtain six food items: Bison Steak, San d'Orian Tea, Icecap Rolanberry, White Bread, Whitefish Stew, and Windurst Salad. Except for the Bison Steak, all of them are sold by merchants, depending on the national Conquest Ranking. All items can be purchased from AH under food. Take note that you may end up spending around 20-35k gil. The most expensive item, Whitefish Stew, can cost 9k if Windurst is in last place! Sometimes NPC prices are cheaper, sometimes more expensive, than AH. Bison Steak may be somewhat difficult to obtain if it's a rarely-sold item on your server's AH and you don't have enough skill in cooking to make it yourself. All of these items can be crafted for around 9k assuming you or a friend has cooking at a high-enough level. If crafted, the items must match requested items. HQ versions will not work. Glyke (Upper Jeuno Merchant located behind the Marble Bridge Door) sells White Bread and Windurst Salad cheaply. You can target her from outside and still buy these items. The appropriate camera angle and positioning of your character is required to target her from outside. Simply rotate your camera and mash ENTER or whatever you use to accept until it doesn't say: "The target is out of range."

nodes.title: Trade them all to Tosuka-Porika for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Trade them all to Tosuka-Porika for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Return to Upper Jeuno and talk to Luto Mewrilah for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Return to Upper Jeuno and talk to Luto Mewrilah for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Go to Port Jeuno and talk to Khumo Daramasteh, (J-8) by the gate to the Chocobo Circuit, to complete
nodes.description: Go to Port Jeuno and talk to Khumo Daramasteh, (J-8) by the gate to the Chocobo Circuit, to complete the quest.

nodes.title: OPTIONAL: Talk with Mataligeat for some insight, then again to Mertaire for an interesting comment.
nodes.description: OPTIONAL: Talk with Mataligeat for some insight, then again to Mertaire for an interesting comment.

nodes.title: Talk to Bki Tbujhja in Lower Jeuno again.
nodes.description: Talk to Bki Tbujhja in Lower Jeuno again. She mentions another set of Song Runes in Valkurm Dunes.

nodes.title: Head to the secret beach at the far west of Valkurm Dunes (C-6).
nodes.description: Head to the secret beach at the far west of Valkurm Dunes (C-6). The fastest way there is to use the Survival Guide warp for Gustav Tunnel.

nodes.title: On the hidden beach, head southeast to the bottom right of (B-7).
nodes.description: On the hidden beach, head southeast to the bottom right of (B-7).

nodes.title: Click on the Song Rune for another cutscene to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Click on the Song Rune for another cutscene to complete the quest.

nodes.title: After completing Save My Son, talk to Brutus in the Chocobo Stables of Upper Jeuno.
nodes.description: After completing Save My Son, talk to Brutus in the Chocobo Stables of Upper Jeuno. If you activate the Chocobo on the Loose! quest doing this, talk to Brutus, then talk to the boy near the steps who is caring for the chocobo, then talk to Brutus again. You may have to talk with him more that once to trigger the cutscene. This will bypass Chocobo on the Loose! and allow you to complete Path of the Beastmaster.

nodes.title: Beastmaster will appear in your job list after you zone.
nodes.description: Beastmaster will appear in your job list after you zone.

nodes.title: Optional: Click on Dietmund's door in Lower Jeuno (G-11) for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Optional: Click on Dietmund's door in Lower Jeuno (G-11) for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Talk to the Nomad Moogle in Ru'Lude Gardens as a level 91+ job to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to the Nomad Moogle in Ru'Lude Gardens as a level 91+ job to start the quest.

nodes.title: Obtain a Seasoning Stone and trade to the Nomad Moogle to obtain a Soul gem clasp and begin the next
nodes.description: Obtain a Seasoning Stone and trade to the Nomad Moogle to obtain a Soul gem clasp and begin the next quest, Beyond Infinity. Optional (but strongly recommended): You may also want to get a second stone in order to obtain an Olde rarab tail that can be used in the genkai fight Beyond Infinity. See next mission page for correct order. (Degenhard will not talk to you or give you the Olde rarab tail until you accept the fight with the Moogle, then select to fight at a later time in order to go receive a Olde rarab tail for the fight.) Olde rarab tail required items: Trade to Degenhard in Bastok Markets (I-10) a Seasoning Stone, Fossilized Bone, and a Fossilized Fang. Note that Beyond Infinity MUST be flagged in order to speak with Degenhard and successfully receive the Olde rarab tail. Seasoning Stones, Fossilized Bones, and Fossilized Fangs are usually available from the Repeat Login Campaign for 10 points each. If you are defeated in the fight for the next quest, you do not need to farm a new Seasoning Stone. The Nomad Moogle will give you a Soul gem clasp in exchange for one Merit Point or 5 High Kindred's Crests.

nodes.title: Players who have successfully completed Beyond Infinity may assist those in need.
nodes.description: Players who have successfully completed Beyond Infinity may assist those in need. NPC Domenic Lower Jeuno (J-7) inside Neptune's Spire offers quick travel to the BCNM (for a minimal fee) to these players.

nodes.title: Talk to Zona Shodhun.
nodes.description: Talk to Zona Shodhun. She's obsessed with flowers and will tell you about gardening. She doesn't ask for help but she collects colored rocks to decorate her garden. (Optional) Trade a colored rock to her and she'll say how pretty and smooth it is, but what she really wants is a Yellow Rock.

nodes.title: Trade a yellow rock to her for your reward.
nodes.description: Trade a yellow rock to her for your reward.

nodes.title: After your NPC is level 51, talk to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno (G-8), who instructs you to go to t
nodes.description: After your NPC is level 51, talk to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno (G-8), who instructs you to go to the hospital and speak with Monberaux at G-10 (may need to zone in with signal pearl equipped). Reportedly there's a problem with people not getting the cutscene from Monberaux and all he mentions is something about Wolfgang. The solution is to spam him (keep clicking on him) and you'll get it. Reportedly there's another problem when the quest doesn't activate when speaking with Luto. Going to the rendezvous point again, then zoning in with pearl equipped may have helped.

nodes.title: With your Signal Pearl in your inventory, go back and speak with Luto Mewrilah.
nodes.description: With your Signal Pearl in your inventory, go back and speak with Luto Mewrilah. After the cutscene, you find out your friend has gone to Qufim Island.

nodes.title: Go to Qufim Island and inspect the Giant Footprint at (E-6) - located near the swirling vortex to Mi
nodes.description: Go to Qufim Island and inspect the Giant Footprint at (E-6) - located near the swirling vortex to Misareaux Coast, in the tunnel that leads to Behemoth's Dominion - for a cutscene and to spawn your NPC buddy and the NM Gigas named Ingaevon (level 53-55). If it says, "There is a gigantic footprint here," you'll have to wait a short time (~5 minutes) to start your CS.

nodes.title: Once you have defeated the NM, speak with your NPC before doing anything else or you can glitch this
nodes.description: Once you have defeated the NM, speak with your NPC before doing anything else or you can glitch this level cap quest in a way GMs are not able to reset!

nodes.title: If you have failed to talk to your NPC and they disappear, zone into Behemoth's Dominion, just down
nodes.description: If you have failed to talk to your NPC and they disappear, zone into Behemoth's Dominion, just down the hall. Zone back in and you should be able to fight the NM again.

nodes.title: Click on the Giant Footprint again after speaking to fellow to progress the quest.
nodes.description: Click on the Giant Footprint again after speaking to fellow to progress the quest. You don't get any key item or anything. It'll just say "There is a gigantic footprint here."

nodes.title: Speak with Luto Mewrilah for a cutscene regarding the truth about Pembroke.
nodes.description: Speak with Luto Mewrilah for a cutscene regarding the truth about Pembroke.

nodes.title: Speak with Monberaux again to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Speak with Monberaux again to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Speak to Anastase to accept the quest and receive the Prototype attuner.
nodes.description: Speak to Anastase to accept the quest and receive the Prototype attuner.

nodes.title: The following steps may be completed in any order.
nodes.description: The following steps may be completed in any order. Completing each step immediately unlocks the Proto-Waypoint for Waypoint teleportation. Travel to Selbina and speak with Jillia at (G-10) to activate the Proto-Waypoint for Selbina. She is by the water/shore. Travel to Mhaura and speak with Zurko-Bazurko at (I-8) to activate the Proto-Waypoint for Mhaura. He is on top of the first floor of the Sailor's Stay, on the outside. From the homepoint just go straight east past the Sailor's Stay and to the left. Travel to Rabao and speak with Quwi Orihbhe at (G-8) to activate the Proto-Waypoint for Rabao. She is on the southeast side of Rabao Spring Travel to Norg and speak with Wistful Bison at (G-7) to activate the Proto-Waypoint for Norg. By the auction house. Talk to Wistful Bison a second time for funny dialogue.

nodes.title: Return to Anastase to complete the quest and receive your rewards of 3 Trail Cookies and 400 Conques
nodes.description: Return to Anastase to complete the quest and receive your rewards of 3 Trail Cookies and 400 Conquest Points.

nodes.title: Talk to Maat at level 61-65 to receive this quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Maat at level 61-65 to receive this quest.

nodes.title: After you flag this quest you can be any job or level to trade the seals.
nodes.description: After you flag this quest you can be any job or level to trade the seals.

nodes.title: He will give you four random clues from the list below.
nodes.description: He will give you four random clues from the list below. He seems to always choose one person in each nation and one in Selbina or Mhaura. Trade a Kindred's Seal to each person you have been assigned (in any order) and they will each in turn give you a different strange stone. (key item) (You can trade any 3 seals to Shami to get 1 Kindred Seal.)

nodes.title: Return to Maat when you have collected all four stones.
nodes.description: Return to Maat when you have collected all four stones.

nodes.title: After completing Collect Tarut Cards, have Chululu test your compatibility on three different game d
nodes.description: After completing Collect Tarut Cards, have Chululu test your compatibility on three different game days (you don't have to wait an hour; just wait until a new game day). To test compatibility, input the name of any character within the area as the password. It can be the same person three times. It can also be an NPC (e.g. one of the two standing in front of her stall, herself or Kurou-Morou). Enter the name exactly as it is in-game, with the first letter capitalized. Even after you've completed Collect Tarut Cards Chululu may still start a dialog with "Oh, what a crying-wying shame!" which launches the quest again. Simply reply "No, Thanks". She will see dark clouds in the horizon, but you'll be able to talk with her again to test your compatibility.

nodes.title: Speak to her on a fourth game day to receive this quest.
nodes.description: Speak to her on a fourth game day to receive this quest.

nodes.title: Baudin tells you that his sister, Audia, has become cursed by some unknown force and craves the bloo
nodes.description: Baudin tells you that his sister, Audia, has become cursed by some unknown force and craves the bloody raw meat of coeurl. Baudin is very concerned with his sister's well being and wishes he could do something to help. He mentions that Audia's fiance, Albrecht, prays at the Cathedral every day for her well-being.

nodes.title: Head to the Cathedral in Upper Jeuno and speak with the minster Mailloquetat for a cutscene with Alb
nodes.description: Head to the Cathedral in Upper Jeuno and speak with the minster Mailloquetat for a cutscene with Albrecht, who tells you that none of his prayers have been answered and that his fiancee is still cursed.

nodes.title: Return to Baudin who will ask if you have any news of his sister's condition.
nodes.description: Return to Baudin who will ask if you have any news of his sister's condition. No matter what you say, Albrecht appears and inquires if there were any changes.

nodes.title: (Side note: an unreferenced girl child NPC turns up again, named Alista.
nodes.description: (Side note: an unreferenced girl child NPC turns up again, named Alista. She also appears in the Cathedral above, at the end of the scene with Albrecht and Mailloquetat.)

nodes.title: Travel to Ru'Lude Gardens and speak with Neraf-Najiruf, in the Jeuno guards' room (G-7), who tells y
nodes.description: Travel to Ru'Lude Gardens and speak with Neraf-Najiruf, in the Jeuno guards' room (G-7), who tells you about a similar problem which was cured by a magical torch. He hands you the Ducal Guard's Lantern (key item) and asks you to light it in Eldieme Necropolis. (Various missions/quests, including the Promathia mission Below the Arks, will take priority for this NPC. Neraf-Najiruf will first talk about the broken crystals at the crags or some other quest. If he does, just talk to him once again and you'll get the lantern.)

nodes.title: If after talking with him Neraf-Najiruf, he only mentions that "One time, a rookie of ours got curse
nodes.description: If after talking with him Neraf-Najiruf, he only mentions that "One time, a rookie of ours got cursed in the necropolis of Eldieme, and I didn't know what to do." then its likely you've not spoken to all of the NPCs the correct amount of times. Baudin, then Mailloquetat (for a cutscene), then Baudin again (another cutscene) and now Neraf-Najiruf should give the quest.

nodes.title: Lower Jeuno (G-11) - Go up the stairs.
nodes.description: Lower Jeuno (G-11) - Go up the stairs. Click on the door Merchant's House for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Optional: Upper Jeuno (G-7) - Talk to Shalott in the Chocobo Stables for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Optional: Upper Jeuno (G-7) - Talk to Shalott in the Chocobo Stables for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Qufim Island (F-8) - (top-left point) find the path going down along the cliff/coast of (F-8).
nodes.description: Qufim Island (F-8) - (top-left point) find the path going down along the cliff/coast of (F-8). Click the Night Flowers at the bottom of the path for a short cutscene. Night Flowers spawn from 21:32 to 05:40 (dawn). An NM named Atkorkamuy spawns at (F-8) at the top of the cliff. It is not aggressive, but it is a high level Notorious Monster. You will probably need sneak and invisible as a low level. Banshee (sneak) along the way that spawn at 20:00. Goblin Bounty Hunter (invisible) run the edge of the cliff at (F-8). A Kraken (sneak) may spawn right on top of the flowers. You can safely interact with the Night Flowers and receive the short cutscene while sneak is applied. Note that the Night Flowers marker on the map image here is slightly east of where the actual walkway/flowers are. You must go all the way down and around the pathway to the right of the blue marker on the map to find the Night Flowers at the very bottom/end of the path in a seaside cave.

nodes.title: Lower Jeuno (G-11) - After the Night Flowers cutscene, click on Dietmund's door again (G-11) for you
nodes.description: Lower Jeuno (G-11) - After the Night Flowers cutscene, click on Dietmund's door again (G-11) for your 2100gil and Beast Whistle. To unlock Beastmaster, complete the next quest (Path of the Beastmaster).

nodes.title: Talk to Derrick, who will give you the option to start a petition.
nodes.description: Talk to Derrick, who will give you the option to start a petition. When you agree, he gives you the Clock Tower Petition to take to other NPCs to sign.

nodes.title: There are 10 NPCs in total that you need to trade the petition to, who agree to sign it.
nodes.description: There are 10 NPCs in total that you need to trade the petition to, who agree to sign it. They are in the following locations:

nodes.title: Talk to Brutus in Upper Jeuno who will give you three Aquafloras (Temporary Key Item) to put in some
nodes.description: Talk to Brutus in Upper Jeuno who will give you three Aquafloras (Temporary Key Item) to put in some Underground Pools in Fei'Yin.

nodes.title: NOTE: To proceed, you must complete A Candlelight Vigil, Rubbish Day, Never to Return.
nodes.description: NOTE: To proceed, you must complete A Candlelight Vigil, Rubbish Day, Never to Return.

nodes.title: Travel to Lower Jeuno (I-7) above the Auction House and speak to Kurou-Morou.
nodes.description: Travel to Lower Jeuno (I-7) above the Auction House and speak to Kurou-Morou.

nodes.title: Travel to Upper Jeuno (G-8) inside the house, just past Luto Mewrilah, and speak to Ilumida who want
nodes.description: Travel to Upper Jeuno (G-8) inside the house, just past Luto Mewrilah, and speak to Ilumida who wants a Moondrop.

nodes.title: Travel to Boyahda Tree, and examine the ??? at (H-8) of the 2nd map between 19:00 and 4:00 (in-game
nodes.description: Travel to Boyahda Tree, and examine the ??? at (H-8) of the 2nd map between 19:00 and 4:00 (in-game time) to spawn Agas.

nodes.title: The fastest way there is via Boyahda Tree Home Point #1 (just outside the Cloister of Storms), if yo
nodes.description: The fastest way there is via Boyahda Tree Home Point #1 (just outside the Cloister of Storms), if you have already activated it. Will only spawn when the moon can be seen, in other words, not during New Moon.

nodes.title: After defeating Agas, examine the ??? again between 19:00 and 4:00 to get the Moondrop.
nodes.description: After defeating Agas, examine the ??? again between 19:00 and 4:00 to get the Moondrop. If there is no time to obtain the item before 4:00, there is no need to defeat the monster again, even after changing areas or logging out. However, it still cannot be obtained during New Moon. Only one party member needs to spawn Agas to enable everyone to obtain the Moondrop. As long a player is in the party when the monster is defeated, it is possible to obtain the key item.

nodes.title: Return to Upper Jeuno and talk to Ilumida for your reward.
nodes.description: Return to Upper Jeuno and talk to Ilumida for your reward.

nodes.title: Optional: Head to Lower Jeuno and talk to Kurou-Morou twice, then Chululu once to complete the story
nodes.description: Optional: Head to Lower Jeuno and talk to Kurou-Morou twice, then Chululu once to complete the storyline.

nodes.title: Enter the palace in Ru'Lude Gardens for a cutscene and a Note Written by Esha'ntarl.
nodes.description: Enter the palace in Ru'Lude Gardens for a cutscene and a Note Written by Esha'ntarl. This is a separate cutscene from the one that concludes Storms of Fate.

nodes.title: Visit the three Promyvions and get the following key items at the Memory Fluxes on the final islands
nodes.description: Visit the three Promyvions and get the following key items at the Memory Fluxes on the final islands (4th floor). You can ascend each floor by looking for the pavillion-like structures with a giant glowing ball inside them. When you kill the glowing balls, there is a chance that it will spawn a teleport that takes you up to the next floor. There are Memory Fluxes on the 3rd floor as well but they are NOT the correct one. The higher floors have monsters that aggro but are easily dispatched at level 99. You can also call Trusts in this zone.

nodes.title: To get to Promyvion - Holla, go to La Theine Plateau in Zulkeim using the Survival Guide or if you a
nodes.description: To get to Promyvion - Holla, go to La Theine Plateau in Zulkeim using the Survival Guide or if you are a White Mage use Teleport Holla, the entry is the Shattered Telepoint (J-8), once you enter into the Hall of Transference go to the Cerment Door at the far end of the chamber and interact with it and you will be pulled into Promyvion Holla.

nodes.title: To get to Promyvion - Dem, go to Konschat Highlands in Zulkeim using the Survival Guide or if you ar
nodes.description: To get to Promyvion - Dem, go to Konschat Highlands in Zulkeim using the Survival Guide or if you are a White Mage use Teleport Dem, as with Crag of Holla, go to the Shattered Telepoint (I-7) and interact with it to enter the Crag of Mea's Hall of Transference and interact with the Cerment Door at the far end and get pulled into Promyvion Dem.

nodes.title: To get to Promyvion - Mea, go to Tahrongi Canyon in Kolshushu using the Survival Guide or Teleport M
nodes.description: To get to Promyvion - Mea, go to Tahrongi Canyon in Kolshushu using the Survival Guide or Teleport Mea if you are a White Mage and head for the Shattered Telepoint (I-6) and enter the Hall of Transference using the Shattered Telepoint and then like the other two go to the Cerment Door within this chamber and you will be pulled into Promyvion Mea. Promyvion - Holla (J-10) - Promyvion - Holla Sliver Promyvion - Dem (K-4) - Promyvion - Dem Sliver Promyvion - Mea (K-6) - Promyvion - Mea Sliver

nodes.title: Return to the palace in Ru'Lude Gardens for a final cutscene with Esha'ntarl.
nodes.description: Return to the palace in Ru'Lude Gardens for a final cutscene with Esha'ntarl.

nodes.title: READ THE NOTE PORTION OF THIS PAGE FIRST FOR AN EASIER FIGHT WITH MAAT.
nodes.description: READ THE NOTE PORTION OF THIS PAGE FIRST FOR AN EASIER FIGHT WITH MAAT.

nodes.title: If you have not yet completed the quest The Road to Aht Urhgan, you can keep your testimony after de
nodes.description: If you have not yet completed the quest The Road to Aht Urhgan, you can keep your testimony after defeating Maat. Trade it to Faursel in Lower Jeuno to recieve your Boarding Permit to access Aht Urhgan Whitegate via Mhaura.

nodes.title: After zoning, talk to Nantoto at H-8 in Lower Jeuno after you have completed 100 separate Records of
nodes.description: After zoning, talk to Nantoto at H-8 in Lower Jeuno after you have completed 100 separate Records of Eminence quests. You must zone if you have just completed Teleports by Twilight. You will receive the message Perhaps it would behoove you to speak with Nantoto in Lower Jeuno (H-8). as you zone into Lower Jeuno, indicating that you are eligible to begin the quest.

nodes.title: She asks you to kill shadows in The Eldieme Necropolis.
nodes.description: She asks you to kill shadows in The Eldieme Necropolis.

nodes.title: Kill 10 shadow family monsters in The Eldieme Necropolis.
nodes.description: Kill 10 shadow family monsters in The Eldieme Necropolis. You must first activate the Records of Eminence quest under Other -> RoE Quests -> Culling The Darkness to get credit. You may want to also accept Conflict: Eldieme Necropolis, since this objective will be completed at the same time. You can complete this portion of the quest as a monipulator to have the experience points awarded to a monster species rather than a job.

nodes.title: When you kill the last shadow, you complete the Records of Eminence objective and receive 1500 spark
nodes.description: When you kill the last shadow, you complete the Records of Eminence objective and receive 1500 sparks and 2500 exp.

nodes.title: Report back to Nantoto for a short cutscene to complete the quest and obtain 5 Copper Vouchers.
nodes.description: Report back to Nantoto for a short cutscene to complete the quest and obtain 5 Copper Vouchers.

nodes.title: Enter the Ducal Palace in Ru'Lude Gardens for a cutscene with Esha'ntarl.
nodes.description: Enter the Ducal Palace in Ru'Lude Gardens for a cutscene with Esha'ntarl.

nodes.title: Return to the Misareaux Coast and head for Cape Riverne.
nodes.description: Return to the Misareaux Coast and head for Cape Riverne. Entering the Dilapidated Gate at (F-7) triggers a required cutscene. Unity 122 to Misareaux Coast puts you by the gate.

nodes.title: Once you've triggered the cutscene, you may use the shortcut warps mentioned below to travel to Rive
nodes.description: Once you've triggered the cutscene, you may use the shortcut warps mentioned below to travel to Riverne - Site #B01. It will be fastest to use the Home Point #1 warp into Riverne - Site #B01 by Monarch Linn. Walk north and click on the Spatial Displacement. If you've completed Further Founts, you can use the waypoint to travel to C-10. If you're walking, you'll be traveling through the "normal" Unstable Displacement at North-East (G-8), which requires a Giant Scale to open. Kill local drakes to obtain a scale and trade to the Unstable Displacements to travel through them.

nodes.title: Head to the green Unstable Displacement on the west-northwest side of the E-7 island.
nodes.description: Head to the green Unstable Displacement on the west-northwest side of the E-7 island. This acts as a battlefield entrance similar to the mini-battlefield in Ghelsba Outpost.

nodes.title: Check the green Unstable Displacement once for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Check the green Unstable Displacement once for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Check it again and select the battle "Storms of Fate" when ready.
nodes.description: Check it again and select the battle "Storms of Fate" when ready.

nodes.title: Complete 50 different Records of Eminence (see testimonials), then talk to Nantoto at H-8 in Lower J
nodes.description: Complete 50 different Records of Eminence (see testimonials), then talk to Nantoto at H-8 in Lower Jeuno.

nodes.title: After the cutscene, go to the Records of Eminence menu, select Other, "RoE Quests", and activate Tel
nodes.description: After the cutscene, go to the Records of Eminence menu, select Other, "RoE Quests", and activate Telepoint Pilgrimage. If you skip this step, you will receive this message upon examining a telepoint: "You already possess the gate crystal for this telepoint." You MUST receive the message, "You have investigated the xxx telepoint."

nodes.title: Investigate all six present-day telepoints to obtain 1500 Sparks and 2500 experience/limit points.
nodes.description: Investigate all six present-day telepoints to obtain 1500 Sparks and 2500 experience/limit points. Make sure that you are on the job for which you wish to receive 2500 experience/limit points when you examine the final telepoint.

nodes.title: Return to Nantoto for a cutscene and three Copper Vouchers.
nodes.description: Return to Nantoto for a cutscene and three Copper Vouchers.

nodes.title: Speak to Ghebi Damomohe at the counter and select the third, blank line of dialogue.
nodes.description: Speak to Ghebi Damomohe at the counter and select the third, blank line of dialogue. Ghebi says that you need either a Tenshodo Invite or a Tenshodo Application Form. This step requires 3 Jeuno Fame. Trading 5 or fewer stacks of La Theine Cabbage in the quest Only the Best will suffice.

nodes.title: Head to Port Bastok and into Warehouse #2 across from the Airship Agency.
nodes.description: Head to Port Bastok and into Warehouse #2 across from the Airship Agency.

nodes.title: Once inside, talk to Jabbar or Silver Owl to receive a Tenshodo Application Form, then head back to
nodes.description: Once inside, talk to Jabbar or Silver Owl to receive a Tenshodo Application Form, then head back to Ghebi Damomohe in Neptune's Spire. Giving Ghebi Damomohe the Tenshodo Application Form grants you a Tenshodo Invite and Tenshodo Member's Card, completing the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Imasuke (standing at the entrance to Qufim).
nodes.description: Talk to Imasuke (standing at the entrance to Qufim). If you are on the quest Hook, Line, and Sinker, you may have to talk to Imasuke several times until he mentions Delkfutt's Tower.

nodes.title: Trade Imasuke a Kaiser Sword to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Trade Imasuke a Kaiser Sword to complete the quest. Kaiser Swords are dropped by Dancing Weapons on Qufim Island or can be purchased from the Auction House.

nodes.title: If you're after the map, it can be bought from a NPC that sells "magical maps." If you already have
nodes.description: If you're after the map, it can be bought from a NPC that sells "magical maps." If you already have the map, you'll obtain 2000gil & 2000 exp instead.

nodes.title: Talk to Mertaire in Lower Jeuno (I-8) who tells you to take the Star ring to an antique collector.
nodes.description: Talk to Mertaire in Lower Jeuno (I-8) who tells you to take the Star ring to an antique collector.

nodes.title: Talk to Imasuke in Port Jeuno (E-6) (near the entrance to Qufim Island).
nodes.description: Talk to Imasuke in Port Jeuno (E-6) (near the entrance to Qufim Island). You may switch to any job after this.

nodes.title: Travel to Xarcabard and check the Perennial Snow at (I-10).
nodes.description: Travel to Xarcabard and check the Perennial Snow at (I-10).

nodes.title: Wait for 1 minute (earth time) then check the Perennial Snow again.
nodes.description: Wait for 1 minute (earth time) then check the Perennial Snow again.

nodes.title: Return to Imasuke, who tells you the language is old San d'Orian and that you should find someone wh
nodes.description: Return to Imasuke, who tells you the language is old San d'Orian and that you should find someone who can read it.

nodes.title: Go to Northern San d'Oria near Home Point #2 and enter the Chateau d'Oraguille.
nodes.description: Go to Northern San d'Oria near Home Point #2 and enter the Chateau d'Oraguille. Find your way to the back at Queen Leaute's Garden (F-7). Talk to Chalvatotto trigger a cutscene. You may need to speak to him twice if this is your first time speaking with him.

nodes.title: Chalvatot gives you a Moon ring and sends you to the Monastic Cavern.
nodes.description: Chalvatot gives you a Moon ring and sends you to the Monastic Cavern. Head to the altar room (I-8), clear the room and examine the altar to pop the NM Bugaboo. Orcish Warlord spawns in the same room and has True Sight. It is recommended to kill surrounding mobs before popping Bugaboo.

nodes.title: After you defeat Bugaboo, check the altar again.
nodes.description: After you defeat Bugaboo, check the altar again. NM only needs to be spawned once for all party members to get the final cutscene.

nodes.title: Go back to talk to Chalvatot in Chateau d'Oraguille to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Go back to talk to Chalvatot in Chateau d'Oraguille to complete the quest.

nodes.title: After completing the quest Save the Clock Tower, head up and select the door to Galmut's house again
nodes.description: After completing the quest Save the Clock Tower, head up and select the door to Galmut's house again, for the ending cutscene and to complete this quest.

nodes.title: (Optional) After completing this quest, talk to Collet again for a short cutscene with Galmut.
nodes.description: (Optional) After completing this quest, talk to Collet again for a short cutscene with Galmut.

nodes.title: Having completed the previous quests, approach the Chocobo Stables at Upper Jeuno (G-7) to trigger a
nodes.description: Having completed the previous quests, approach the Chocobo Stables at Upper Jeuno (G-7) to trigger a cutscene with Jeridade and Mapitoto.

nodes.title: Purchase a Celestial Nexus phantom gem for 10 Merit Points from a High-Tier Mission Battlefields NPC
nodes.description: Purchase a Celestial Nexus phantom gem for 10 Merit Points from a High-Tier Mission Battlefields NPC.

nodes.title: Travel to the Celestial Nexus.
nodes.description: Travel to the Celestial Nexus. Most easily via Home Point (Tu'Lia > Shrine of Ru'Avitau > Home Point #1).

nodes.title: Activate the door and choose The Celestial Nexus from the battlefields available.
nodes.description: Activate the door and choose The Celestial Nexus from the battlefields available. Any difficulty level will suffice.

nodes.title: Defeat Eald'narche.
nodes.description: Defeat Eald'narche. You will receive a short cutscene and the Broken flying machine.

nodes.title: Return to Mapitoto at Upper Jeuno (G-7) for another cutscene with Jeridade.
nodes.description: Return to Mapitoto at Upper Jeuno (G-7) for another cutscene with Jeridade. You will lose your Broken flying machine.

nodes.title: Journey to the Strange Apparatus at Fei'Yin (G-6) and select it receive a clue as to your next step.
nodes.description: Journey to the Strange Apparatus at Fei'Yin (G-6) and select it receive a clue as to your next step. Via Home Point (Fauregandi > Fei'Yin > Home Point #2), though there's a lengthy walk.

nodes.title: Obtain a Green Chip .
nodes.description: Obtain a Green Chip . Either from another player, a BCNM, or the goblin merchants in each city that sell them for 21,000 gil.

nodes.title: Obtain an Infinity Core .
nodes.description: Obtain an Infinity Core . Either from Dynamis, or from the Auction House (Others > Misc.)

nodes.title: Obtain 38x Crystal Clusters .
nodes.description: Obtain 38x Crystal Clusters . The total amount can be of any combination of types. Either from the Ephemeral Moogle if you have stored crystals, the Auction House, or dropped from Elementals in Ru'Aun Gardens and Ve'Lugannon Palace where you will be heading next.

nodes.title: Obtain a Ve'Lugannon Coffer Key .
nodes.description: Obtain a Ve'Lugannon Coffer Key . Either from the Curio Vendor Moogle for 5,000 gil if you possess the Rhapsody in Umber, or from Detectors, Dustbusters, Mystic Weapons and Ornamental Weapons in Ve'Lugannon Palace.

nodes.title: Find the Coffer in Ve'Lugannon Palace and open it with the key to receive the Levitation device.
nodes.description: Find the Coffer in Ve'Lugannon Palace and open it with the key to receive the Levitation device.

nodes.title: Obtain Doctor status.
nodes.description: Obtain Doctor status. You must obtain doctor status from another zone.

nodes.title: Return to the Strange Apparatus at Fei'Yin (G-6) and select it.
nodes.description: Return to the Strange Apparatus at Fei'Yin (G-6) and select it. It will confirm whether you have Doctor or Administrator status (without Doctor status, you will be unable to continue). The Strange Apparatus in Fei'Yin will NOT administer Doctor status if you do not have it.

nodes.title: Trade the Green Chip and Infinity Core to the Strange Apparatus for further dialogue.
nodes.description: Trade the Green Chip and Infinity Core to the Strange Apparatus for further dialogue. You will lose your Levitation device.

nodes.title: Trade the 38x Crystal Clusters to the Strange Apparatus to receive the Whirring engine.
nodes.description: Trade the 38x Crystal Clusters to the Strange Apparatus to receive the Whirring engine.

nodes.title: Speak to Mapitoto at Upper Jeuno (G-7) for a cutscene with Jeridade and Brutus.
nodes.description: Speak to Mapitoto at Upper Jeuno (G-7) for a cutscene with Jeridade and Brutus. You will lose your Whirring engine and receive the Levitus key.

nodes.title: Talk to Bluffnix to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Bluffnix to start the quest. If you are unable to start the quest, verify your reputation through Mendi (H-8) across from Waag-Deeg's Magic Shop.

nodes.title: Trade the Dhalmel Leather, Steel Ingot, Linen Cloth, and Peridot to Bluffnix (these items can all be
nodes.description: Trade the Dhalmel Leather, Steel Ingot, Linen Cloth, and Peridot to Bluffnix (these items can all be found on the Auction House and/or crafted). You can also trade a Goblin Stew 880 instead of the four items to instantly complete the quest.

nodes.title: After trading the items, your Gobbiebag capacity increases by 5 slots to a new total of 35.
nodes.description: After trading the items, your Gobbiebag capacity increases by 5 slots to a new total of 35. If you have a Mog Satchel, it is also upgraded immediately to the same maximum capacity. If you have a Mog Sack, talk to an Artisan Moogle and ask for an upgrade after completing this quest to increase your Mog Sack capacity by 5 as well. If you do not yet have a Mog Satchel and/or Mog Sack but you acquire one later, it is automatically upgraded to the maximum capacity of your Gobbiebag, so there is no need to acquire one before completing Gobbiebag quests.

nodes.title: Talk to Bluffnix to start the quest.
nodes.description: Talk to Bluffnix to start the quest. If you are unable to start the quest, verify your reputation through Mendi (H-8) across from Waag-Deeg's Magic Shop.

nodes.title: Guttrix wants a Magical Pattern from a treasure chest either from Gusgen Mines, Ordelle's Caves, or
nodes.description: Guttrix wants a Magical Pattern from a treasure chest either from Gusgen Mines, Ordelle's Caves, or Maze of Shakhrami during the week of your race.

nodes.title: You have one game week as dictated by Guttrix to get a Magical Pattern.
nodes.description: You have one game week as dictated by Guttrix to get a Magical Pattern. A game week is Firesday through Darksday. You can obtain multiple RSE items each game week, up to all 4 items.

nodes.title: As long you still have this quest active, you may check with Guttrix to see if it is your race's wee
nodes.description: As long you still have this quest active, you may check with Guttrix to see if it is your race's week. Or you can check the Vana'diel Clocks.

nodes.title: The race order is Hume Males, Hume Females, Elvaan Males, Elvaan Females, Tarutaru Males, Tarutaru F
nodes.description: The race order is Hume Males, Hume Females, Elvaan Males, Elvaan Females, Tarutaru Males, Tarutaru Females, Mithra, and Galka.

nodes.title: You can only carry ONE Magical Pattern at a time.
nodes.description: You can only carry ONE Magical Pattern at a time. So if its your races week, it goes: Farm the Key, pop the chest, turn in the pattern, repeat.

nodes.title: Once you turn in a Magical Pattern you won't get the quest in your log again, but you can continue t
nodes.description: Once you turn in a Magical Pattern you won't get the quest in your log again, but you can continue to do the quest until you have full RSE.

nodes.title: http://www.pyogenes.com/ffxi/timer/v2.html has a good RSE calendar.
nodes.description: http://www.pyogenes.com/ffxi/timer/v2.html has a good RSE calendar. - seems desynchronized with the game worlds' time. Better check for yourself before trusting it

nodes.title: Vana'naVi Vana'Diel Clock.
nodes.description: Vana'naVi Vana'Diel Clock

nodes.title: Chest keys can be purchased from a Curio Vendor Moogle if you have Rhapsody in White.
nodes.description: Chest keys can be purchased from a Curio Vendor Moogle if you have Rhapsody in White.

nodes.title: Deliver the Two of Swords (Key Item) to Apururu at the Manustery in Windurst Woods.
nodes.description: Deliver the Two of Swords (Key Item) to Apururu at the Manustery in Windurst Woods.

nodes.title: If you are on The Jester Who'd Be King or Moon Reading you will be unable to deliver Two of Swords t
nodes.description: If you are on The Jester Who'd Be King or Moon Reading you will be unable to deliver Two of Swords to Apururu.

nodes.title: After receiving the cutscene from Apururu, go to the southwest tower in West Sarutabaruta (at F-11).
nodes.description: After receiving the cutscene from Apururu, go to the southwest tower in West Sarutabaruta (at F-11). Ten of Cups appears at J-8 on that map, which is a hidden area behind another hidden area behind a cracked wall.

nodes.title: Once you have the Ten of Cups (Card), take it back to the Manustery (North) and trade it to Apururu.
nodes.description: Once you have the Ten of Cups (Card), take it back to the Manustery (North) and trade it to Apururu.

nodes.title: Return to Lower Jeuno and talk to Panta-Putta (G-10) to finish the quest.
nodes.description: Return to Lower Jeuno and talk to Panta-Putta (G-10) to finish the quest.

nodes.title: The Two of Swords has gone missing.
nodes.description: The Two of Swords has gone missing. Nobody knows where he has gone off to. OPTIONAL: Speak to Teigero-Bangero who tell you he haven't seen it.

nodes.title: Talk to Panta-Putta, who reveals what happened to the Super Soup Pot and wonders about Two of Swords
nodes.description: Talk to Panta-Putta, who reveals what happened to the Super Soup Pot and wonders about Two of Swords fate. OPTIONAL: Speak to Bozz in Upper Jeuno at (G-9), across from Home Point #3.

nodes.title: Next, speak to Monberaux in Upper Jeuno (opposite of where Bozz is).
nodes.description: Next, speak to Monberaux in Upper Jeuno (opposite of where Bozz is). In a cutscene, he tells you he found Two of Swords after he shut himself down because Panta-Putta broke his heart. He gives you the Two of Swords, the reward and title. You may have to talk to him several times (up to 7), even if he repeats things he has already said relating to other quests and/or missions.

nodes.title: Speak to Rakuru-Rakoru in Lower Jeuno as a level 75+ job and agree to his proposal.
nodes.description: Speak to Rakuru-Rakoru in Lower Jeuno as a level 75+ job and agree to his proposal.

nodes.title: You must defeat the following notorious monsters with the Data Analyzer and Logger EX in your posses
nodes.description: You must defeat the following notorious monsters with the Data Analyzer and Logger EX in your possession:

nodes.title: Talk to Mertaire (I-8, Merry Minstrel Meadhouse in Lower Jeuno), who will lament on a lost love.
nodes.description: Talk to Mertaire (I-8, Merry Minstrel Meadhouse in Lower Jeuno), who will lament on a lost love. OPTIONAL: Talk to Mataligeat at the counter for a related observation.

nodes.title: Talk to Bki Tbujhja, behind the counter in the same room, who talks about the Song Runes in Buburimu
nodes.description: Talk to Bki Tbujhja, behind the counter in the same room, who talks about the Song Runes in Buburimu Peninsula and how it would cheer up the broken-hearted.

nodes.title: Obtain a Parchment and Head to Buburimu Peninsula The fastest way is the Survival Guide in Bibiki Ba
nodes.description: Obtain a Parchment and Head to Buburimu Peninsula The fastest way is the Survival Guide in Bibiki Bay. If you do not have enough skill to craft a Parchment, you can buy one for around 2000 gil from Pikini-Mikini, found at the Warehouse in Mhaura.

nodes.title: On the western edge of the Khoonta Dunes (beach), there is a hidden path in the shallows (G-10) that
nodes.description: On the western edge of the Khoonta Dunes (beach), there is a hidden path in the shallows (G-10) that takes you to (F/G-9).

nodes.title: Click the Song Runes, on the west side up from the beach for a cutscene with Lewenhart.
nodes.description: Click the Song Runes, on the west side up from the beach for a cutscene with Lewenhart.

nodes.title: Trade a Parchment to the the Song Runes to obtain the Poetic Parchment.
nodes.description: Trade a Parchment to the the Song Runes to obtain the Poetic Parchment.

nodes.title: This completes this quest and shows up as same in your Jeuno: Completed Quests log.
nodes.description: This completes this quest and shows up as same in your Jeuno: Completed Quests log. The next prerequisite quest for getting the Bard job is A Minstrel in Despair.

nodes.title: You must be on BRD to activate the cutscene.
nodes.description: You must be on BRD to activate the cutscene.

nodes.title: Talk to Faursel inside Neptune's Spire for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Faursel inside Neptune's Spire for a cutscene.

nodes.title: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Talk to Laila as a Lv.50+ Dancer.
nodes.description: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Talk to Laila as a Lv.50+ Dancer. She tells you to find a musician. To save time, acquire Yagudo Glue and set your main job to Dancer before heading to Jugner Forest (S).

nodes.title: Zone into Jugner Forest (S) for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Zone into Jugner Forest (S) for a cutscene. You can receive the cutscene while riding a mount. The fastest way to do this section is to warp to the Survival Guide in Batallia Downs (S) if you have it, then zone into Jugner Forest (S), get the cutscene, then proceed as below to (I-5). Alternately, exit Upper Jeuno to Batallia Downs and proceed to the Cavernous Maw at (H-5). Use the maw to zone into Batallia Downs (S), then go to (E-9) to exit to Jugner Forest (S).

nodes.title: (Jugner Forest (S) I-5) Click the Glowing Pebbles for cutscene.
nodes.description: (Jugner Forest (S) I-5) Click the Glowing Pebbles for cutscene. The Shrouded Piper asks you to bring him a block of Yagudo Glue. You must approach the ??? from the northeast, near the zone to Batallia Downs (S), due to a fence not marked on the in-game map. You may also use the Campaign warp to the Fortification and head to (I-5) using the rock bridge that is a dead end after dropping off on the main road, but still have to go around to the Batallia Downs (S) path to get to there. Yagudo Glue is dropped by Bard-type Yagudo in the past. Yagudo Pipers are the lowest-level enemies that drop the glue, and can be found right outside the entrance to Giddeus in West Sarutabaruta (S) in 3 spawn locations. A much larger concentration of these monsters is in Castle Oztroja (S) but they are levels 77-79, so take precautions. You do not need to be on Dancer for the Yagudo Glue to drop. For the next step, you must be on Dancer to complete the remainder of the quest.

nodes.title: (Jugner Forest (S) I-5) Trade the Yagudo Glue to the Glowing Pebbles in Jugner Forest (S) at (I-5).
nodes.description: (Jugner Forest (S) I-5) Trade the Yagudo Glue to the Glowing Pebbles in Jugner Forest (S) at (I-5).

nodes.title: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Speak with Laila again to receive Dancer's Tights.
nodes.description: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Speak with Laila again to receive Dancer's Tights.

nodes.title: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Talk to Laila as a Lv.40+ Dancer to begin the quest.
nodes.description: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Talk to Laila as a Lv.40+ Dancer to begin the quest.

nodes.title: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Next, talk to Rhea Myuliah right beside her.
nodes.description: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Next, talk to Rhea Myuliah right beside her.

nodes.title: Travel to Grauberg (S).
nodes.description: Travel to Grauberg (S). Be sure you go to Grauberg (S) in the Wings of the Goddess era, not Grauberg in the Abyssea region. If possible, mount up to avoid true sight Grauberg Hippogryphs along the way.

nodes.title: (Grauberg (S) F-5) Check the ??? for a cutscene.
nodes.description: (Grauberg (S) F-5) Check the ??? for a cutscene. Your main job MUST be set to Dancer to receive the cutscene. The ??? is in the middle of a cluster of three trees, just to the NW of the Veridical Conflux.

nodes.title: (Grauberg (S) F-5) Check ??? a second time to spawn NM Migratory Hippogryph.
nodes.description: (Grauberg (S) F-5) Check ??? a second time to spawn NM Migratory Hippogryph. If you zone before checking the ???, it will not spawn; you must receive the cutscene and then spawn the NM without zoning. Therefore, your main job MUST be Dancer for this fight. There are many Sidhe near the ???. However, unlike most pixies, Sidhe do not cure players.

nodes.title: (Grauberg (S) F-5) Check the ??? a third and final time after the NM dies to receive "The Essence of
nodes.description: (Grauberg (S) F-5) Check the ??? a third and final time after the NM dies to receive "The Essence of Dance" and a cutscene. The Migratory Hippogryph only needs to be defeated once per party/alliance in order for all Dancers on the quest to get the second cutscene and the key item. Just be sure that everyone has examined the ??? at least once for the initial cutscene. If someone has just defeated the NM, it may take a few minutes for the ??? to spawn another Migratory Hippogryph.

nodes.title: (/keyitem) Navigate to the permanent key item menu and read the key item description.
nodes.description: (/keyitem) Navigate to the permanent key item menu and read the key item description.

nodes.title: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Talk to Laila at (G-7) to receive a War Hoop Again, you must examine your key item
nodes.description: (Upper Jeuno G-7) Talk to Laila at (G-7) to receive a War Hoop Again, you must examine your key item first in order to get the cutscene, and your main job must still be Dancer.

nodes.title: Talk to Panta-Putta, located at the merchant's house at G-10 in Lower Jeuno, for a cutscene.
nodes.description: Talk to Panta-Putta, located at the merchant's house at G-10 in Lower Jeuno, for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Talk to him again.
nodes.description: Talk to him again. He wants you to bring him a Wonder Magic Set.

nodes.title: Wonder Magic Set is obtained from the related quest Child's Play.
nodes.description: Wonder Magic Set is obtained from the related quest Child's Play. To summarize: Go to Port Jeuno and talk to Karl at H-8, across from the Synergy Furnace. He tells you that he'll trade you the Wonder Magic Set for a White Rock. White Rock is available from Goldsmithing Guild Merchants, a rare drop from Mog Garden Mining, other hobbies, and may be for sale from the Auction House fairly cheap. Trade Karl the White Rock to obtain the Wonder Magic Set.

nodes.title: Return to Lower Jeuno and talk to Panta-Putta to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Return to Lower Jeuno and talk to Panta-Putta to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Talk to Nantoto at H-8 in Lower Jeuno after completing 150 separate Records of Eminence objectives,
nodes.description: Talk to Nantoto at H-8 in Lower Jeuno after completing 150 separate Records of Eminence objectives, including Petals of Recollection.

nodes.title: She asks you to kill a Yagudo High Priest in Castle Oztroja.
nodes.description: She asks you to kill a Yagudo High Priest in Castle Oztroja.

nodes.title: Activate RoE Quest Grudge listed under category:Records of Eminence > Other > RoE Quests.
nodes.description: Activate RoE Quest Grudge listed under category:Records of Eminence > Other > RoE Quests.

nodes.title: Travel to Castle Oztroja and kill 1 Yagudo High Priest to complete the RoE quest.
nodes.description: Travel to Castle Oztroja and kill 1 Yagudo High Priest to complete the RoE quest. The priest is through the trap door at the top of the castle. See Castle Oztroja/Maps. Refer to the Brass Statue page for passwords that allow access to the Yagudo High Priest's area. The sparks and EXP are awarded at this point. This objective can be completed as a monipulator if you wish to obtain the EXP for a monster rather than a job.

nodes.title: Report back to Nantoto for a cutscene to complete the quest and obtain 12 Copper Vouchers.
nodes.description: Report back to Nantoto for a cutscene to complete the quest and obtain 12 Copper Vouchers.

nodes.title: Talk to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno (G-8).
nodes.description: Talk to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno (G-8).

nodes.title: She shows you a list of races and genders; select one.
nodes.description: She shows you a list of races and genders; select one. These belong to your Adventuring Fellow later on, so choose wisely. It is impossible to change them later.

nodes.title: After choosing the name, go see Kuah Dakonsa in Lower Jeuno (H-8), Akta in Ru'Lude Gardens (H-10), a
nodes.description: After choosing the name, go see Kuah Dakonsa in Lower Jeuno (H-8), Akta in Ru'Lude Gardens (H-10), and Red Ghost in Port Jeuno (G-8). It doesn't matter in which order you visit these three NPCs.

nodes.title: Talk to Zalsuhm in Muckvix's Junk Shop with your Dancing Dagger from Nyzul Isle equipped for a cutsc
nodes.description: Talk to Zalsuhm in Muckvix's Junk Shop with your Dancing Dagger from Nyzul Isle equipped for a cutscene. Only the base weapon is required; no upgrades or progress along the Arms of Balrahn questline is required. The weapon must be equipped in your main hand to activate the cutscene. If you choose the wrong answer (saying something like "He has shifty eyes...") he will get angry and you will not start the quest. Zone out and come back again for another chance.

nodes.title: Accumulate 250 Weapon Skill Points on your Dancing Dagger.
nodes.description: Accumulate 250 Weapon Skill Points on your Dancing Dagger. The Nyzul weapon MUST be equipped in Main Hand to get weapon skill credit! Regardless of Nyzul Isle Investigation progress, only 250 Weapon Skill Points are needed to complete any Unlocking a Myth quest as of July 2014.

nodes.title: Once you have acquired enough Weapon Skill points, you will see Mordant Rime available under your li
nodes.description: Once you have acquired enough Weapon Skill points, you will see Mordant Rime available under your list of weapon skills, but only while your Dancing Dagger is still equipped. There will be no message in the chat log informing you of this; it will simply appear in the list.

nodes.title: Return and trade your unlocked weapon to Zalsuhm.
nodes.description: Return and trade your unlocked weapon to Zalsuhm. This fully unlocks Mordant Rime for use with any Dagger (as Bard).

nodes.title: Talk to Zalsuhm in Muckvix's Junk Shop with your Double Axe from Nyzul Isle equipped for a cutscene.

nodes.title: Defeat Ig-Alima in Valkurm Dunes.
nodes.description: Defeat Ig-Alima in Valkurm Dunes. Rifts are located at (F-8), (K-7), and (K-8).

nodes.title: The quest automatically is completed once you kill Ig-Alima.
nodes.description: The quest automatically is completed once you kill Ig-Alima.

nodes.title: Defeat Botulus Rex in Buburimu Peninsula.
nodes.description: Defeat Botulus Rex in Buburimu Peninsula. Rifts are located at (F-9), (H-9), and (J-9).

nodes.title: The quest is instantly completed after you kill Botulus Rex.
nodes.description: The quest is instantly completed after you kill Botulus Rex.

nodes.title: Orcish crest.
nodes.description: Orcish crest

nodes.title: Quadav crest.
nodes.description: Quadav crest

nodes.title: Yagudo crest.
nodes.description: Yagudo crest

nodes.title: Talk to Brutus in Upper Jeuno with your main job set to Beastmaster level 40 or higher.
nodes.description: Talk to Brutus in Upper Jeuno with your main job set to Beastmaster level 40 or higher. Speak to Brutus until he asks you to find a Guiding Bell (he may talk about other quests first).

nodes.title: From this point on, you can complete the quest on any job.
nodes.description: From this point on, you can complete the quest on any job. Once you've flagged the quest, you don't need to be Beastmaster to finish.

nodes.title: You'll need a Delkfutt Chest Key.
nodes.description: You'll need a Delkfutt Chest Key. Either: buy one from a Curio Vendor Moogle. OR Go to Delkfutt's Tower and kill enemies for one. The key is dropped by Gigas in the basement of Lower Delkfutt's Tower and on the tenth floor in Upper Delkfutt's Tower, as well as by Thunder Elementals, Magic Urns, and Evil Spirits in the tower.

nodes.title: Next, head to Upper Delkfutt's Tower.
nodes.description: Next, head to Upper Delkfutt's Tower. There is a Home Point on the 12th floor at (F-9). If you have a Delkfutt Key or Delkfutt Key, enter Delkfutt's Tower from Qufim Island and proceed to the locked door at (E-8). Once past the door (map changes), go to the elevator at (H-8) to teleport straight to the tenth floor.

nodes.title: Open a Treasure Chest found somewhere on the 8th, 9th, or 10th floor to find the Guiding Bell.
nodes.description: Open a Treasure Chest found somewhere on the 8th, 9th, or 10th floor to find the Guiding Bell. You can receive the Guiding Bell as any job. If your job is Thief, you can pick the lock to avoid farming a key.

nodes.title: Return to Brutus to complete the quest.
nodes.description: Return to Brutus to complete the quest.

nodes.title: Speak to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno to receive a cutscene and a Magian Mooglehood missive.
nodes.description: Speak to Luto Mewrilah in Upper Jeuno to receive a cutscene and a Magian Mooglehood missive.

nodes.title: Speak to the Orange Magian Moogle, who will give you a Tandem Necklace +2.
nodes.description: Speak to the Orange Magian Moogle, who will give you a Tandem Necklace +2.

nodes.title: Trade the Tandem Necklace +2 to the blue Magian Moogle to start Trial 4446.
nodes.description: Trade the Tandem Necklace +2 to the blue Magian Moogle to start Trial 4446.

nodes.title: Have your fellow perform 20 weapon skills on experience-yielding targets.
nodes.description: Have your fellow perform 20 weapon skills on experience-yielding targets. Your chat log will notify you after each of your fellow's weapon skills of the number remaining (Trial 4446: X objectives remaining). Tandem Necklace +2 must be equipped. It is optimal to set your fellow to Fierce Attacker for this quest, and not to equip him/her with a club, in order to avoid Moonlight and Starlight, which do not count for this quest. Corsair rolls such as Hunter's Roll (enhanced accuracy) and Tactician's Roll (TP regain) will buff your fellow as long as they are within range or area of effect.

nodes.title: Trade the Tandem Necklace +2 back to the Magian Moogle for a Mythril Meed.
nodes.description: Trade the Tandem Necklace +2 back to the Magian Moogle for a Mythril Meed.

nodes.title: Trade the Mythril Meed to Luto Mewrilah.
nodes.description: Trade the Mythril Meed to Luto Mewrilah.

nodes.title: Speak to Kurou-Morou Lower Jeuno (I-7) who asks for a crystal ball and how you can make/get one.
nodes.description: Speak to Kurou-Morou Lower Jeuno (I-7) who asks for a crystal ball and how you can make/get one.

nodes.title: Obtain an Ahriman Lens, which is dropped by Ahrimans.
nodes.description: Obtain an Ahriman Lens, which is dropped by Ahrimans. The lens is Exclusive, and cannot be traded, purchased from the Auction House, or sent via Delivery Box to another player. The lens can, however, be sent to the Delivery Box of another character on the sender's own account.

nodes.title: {Maze of Shakhrami G-5} Map #1.
nodes.description: {Maze of Shakhrami G-5} Map #1. Locate and trade the Ahriman Lens to the Rockwell at (G-5). Map #1 can be reached from Tahrongi Canyon or the Survival Guide For those without a map, hug the left wall from the entrance heading towards the Attohwa Chasm zone. Turn east right before zoning into Attohwa Chasm to reach the Rockwell.

nodes.title: {Maze of Shakhrami G-5} Map #1.
nodes.description: {Maze of Shakhrami G-5} Map #1. Click on the Rockwell again to receive the Divination Sphere. Wait 1 earth minute if you do not receive the Divination Sphere immediately after clicking on the Rockwell.

nodes.title: {Lower Jeuno I-7} Trade Kurou-Morou the Divination Sphere to complete the quest.
nodes.description: {Lower Jeuno I-7} Trade Kurou-Morou the Divination Sphere to complete the quest. If you have not completed Collect Tarut Cards, then you will receive a cutscene with Chululu.
